caption.center: CREDIT BUREAUS ADJUSTMENT DEPARTMENT, INC., Appellant, v. ALLEN ET UX,

opinion.posture:
Appeal from Circuit Court, Deschutes County.
ROBERT H. FOLEY, Judge.
DISMISSED.
opinion.attorneys:
Gale K. Powell, Bend, argued the cause and filed briefs for appellant.
Lyman C. Johnson, Bend, argued the cause for respondents. On the brief were McKay, Panner, Johnson Marceau.
opinion.panel: Before PERRY, Chief Justice, and McALLISTER, O'CONNELL, GOODWIN, DENECKE, HOLMAN and LUSK, Justices.
opinion.opinion_text:
The trial court entered an order sustaining defendants' demurrer to one of the causes of action in an amended complaint filed by the plaintiff. The order allowed the plaintiff ten days within which to pleadPage 243 further. Plaintiff did not plead further, but no judgment was entered. Plaintiff has attempted to appeal from the order sustaining the demurrer. Such an order is not appealable and this court is without jurisdiction of the cause, Sandblast v.Oregon Liq. Cont. Com., 177 Or. 213, 216, 161 P.2d 919, and cases there cited.
The appeal is dismissed.Page 244
